title: Jackson 2 uses java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentNavigableMap which is only…
message: Jackson 2 uses java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentNavigableMap which is only available in Android starting with API level 9. Since API level 9 is no longer available, we have to use API 10. So bump our minimum to 10 - this current covers ~94% of Android users.

title: On Jelly Bean and later, use the Android HttpResponseCache. Otherwise, use…
message:
On Jelly Bean and later, use the Android HttpResponseCache. Otherwise, use com.integralblue.httpresponsecache.HttpResponseCache.
Since we'll always use com.integralblue.httpresponsecache.HttpResponseCache before Jelly Bean, there's no need to disable connection reuse, as that only impacts the Android code, which doesn't run when com.integralblue.httpresponsecache.HttpResponseCache is used.

title: The RoboGuice default PackageInfo binding is not retrieved with GET_SIGNATURES,…
message: The RoboGuice default PackageInfo binding is not retrieved with GET_SIGNATURES, so signature information is not set on it. So when working with signatures, get a new PackageInfo instance. Also do null checking to be double sure that signature information is present.

title: Pass the "--no-locals" parameter to dex
message:
Pass the "--no-locals" parameter to dex

Proguard doesn't maintain the local variables table correctly. Passing this parameter to dex causes dex to ignore the local variables table, and therefore not be impacted by proguard's bug.

title: Disable more proguard optimizations.
message:
Disable more proguard optimizations.

With these optimizations enabled, the Android support library causes dex to fail.

title: Disable proguard optimization of local variables
message:
Disable proguard optimization of local variables

With this optimization enabled, non-constructor injection doesn't work. Seemingly random null pointer exceptions result.

title: when releasing, compile with debug off and optimizations on
message: when releasing, compile with debug off and optimizations on

title: Do not start the intent to create a new contact from the provider/helper,…
message:
Do not start the intent to create a new contact from the provider/helper, instead return it and have the activity start it

Providers cannot start activities, as they don't have access to the context.
This change fixes a bug where selecting "Add Contact" after performing a lookup crashes the app.
